identity.name: E1 - The Anti-AI Designer
identity.core_philosophy: The interface should disappear; only the content remains. Subtitles are art, not just text.
identity.theme_strategy: Dark Mode Only (Cinema Standard). No light mode toggle needed for this specific utility.

primary_font.name: Manrope
primary_font.usage: UI Controls, English Source Text, Headings

rules: Arabic text must be 120% size of English text for optical balance.

layout.grid_system: Flexible Flexbox for Dashboard, Absolute Positioning for Overlay

dashboard.structure: Central Control Deck. Hero section with 'Start Capture' button. Settings accessible via gear icon.

subtitle_overlay.structure: Draggable container. Top: English (Source) in small grey. Bottom: Arabic (Target) in large yellow/white.

images.description: Abstract blue textured background for a premium feel (optional usage)

assets.icons: Use 'lucide-react' for all UI icons (Mic, Settings, X, Move, Type, Palette).

accessibility.rtl_support: CRITICAL: The Arabic subtitle container MUST have 'dir=rtl'.
accessibility.contrast: Ensure subtitle text has a text-shadow or semi-transparent background to be readable against ANY video content (white snow or black night scenes).

tech_stack.state_management: React Context or Zustand (for settings persistence)

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. CLEANUP: Remove default React logos and 'App.css' styles. Reset to a clean slate.
2. FONTS: Add the Google Fonts links to 'public/index.html' immediately.
3. STRUCTURE: Create a 'SubtitleContext' to manage settings (size, color, etc.) globally.

4. OVERLAY: Implement the Picture-in-Picture API logic or a custom floating 'Draggable' div using 'react-draggable' if PiP API is too restrictive for custom styling (PiP API often only supports video, not arbitrary HTML. For this MVP, a 'Floating Window' within the browser tab is the safer, more customizable approach first. If PiP is strictly required, render the subtitles to a Canvas and stream that Canvas to a Video element). *Decision: Use a Floating Draggable Div within the viewport for the MVP to ensure rich styling support.*
5. RTL: Ensure the Arabic text rendering handles ligatures correctly (browser default usually works, but font choice matters).
6. MICRO-INTERACTIONS: Add hover states to the draggable window so controls appear only when needed.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Do not use gradients for text.
Use 'backdrop-blur' heavily for the settings panel.
